revised_title: Effects of Prolonged Heating on the Magnetic Properties of Iron: An Investigation into the Temperature Dependence of Hysteresis
tldr: This study investigates the effects of prolonged heating on the magnetic properties of iron, particularly the hysteresis, at various temperatures. The results show that hysteresis increases with time and temperature, but at higher temperatures, a maximum value is reached, followed by a decrease in hysteresis with further heating.
